nodes.summary:
Design, Prepress, & Digital Production: Responsible for all print design and typesetting requests. On going design and development of the company website and web app. Print file pre-flight, troubleshooting, and quality control.
On-demand rapid turnaround of print collateral, operator of four Konica Minolta digital presses and a Canon Wide Format printer.
nodes.details:
### Design
- Responsible for all design and typesetting requests.
- Work with company owners to refresh and refine their corporate identity system.
- On going design and development of the company website and order processing application.

### Prepress
- Pre-flight print files to ensure they meet print quality standards.
- Fix or alter print files upon request.

### Digital Print Production
- Digital print department manager, responsible for quality control of all digitally printed jobs.
- On-demand, rapid turnaround of print collateral.
- Operation of four Konica Minolta digital presses and a Canon Wide format printer.
- Maintain a flexible production schedule to accomodate same day turnaround and large volume print runs.
- Ensure print imposition meets various bindery and finishing requirements.
- Coordinate with equvendors to perform maintenance on digital printing equipment.
- Supply inventory

nodes.summary: Throughout my highschool career and after I worked closely with the [Safe Schools Program](http://www.doe.mass.edu/sfs/lgbtq/) as part of the [Massachusetts Gender and Sexuality Alliance (GSA) Leadership Council](http://www.doe.mass.edu/sfs/lgbtq/GSALcouncil.html) in the Greater Boston Region. The statewide council was designed to empower LGBTQ student youth with leadership and facilitation skills to influence change throught the Massachusetts public school system. On occassion I also helped design event materials like workshop packets, pins, stickers, and binder covers.
nodes.details:
### Regional Staff Member and Training Team:
Each year I worked closely with program directors to co-facilitate the kick-off Massachusetts GSA Leadership Summit event in August.
- Pass down my knowledge/experience as a previous student particpant.
- Help transition students into new regional staff members.
- Facilitate or support various workshops throughout the summit event.
- Ensure a safe and inclusive learning environment.
- Help other students develop leadership/facilitation skills to create change within their schools.
- Remain accessible as a mentor/advisor to students at the summit and the following school year.

### Student participant:
I was required to attend the kick-off MA GSA Leadership Summit in August to receive training around LGBTQ issues and develop leadership/facilitation skills. The following school year I took what I learned back to my local highschool GSA.
- Work with school faculty/administration to promote inclusion/change within my school.
- Along with my peers, we took on initiatives like the [Day of Silence](https://www.glsen.org/day-of-silence), [Spirit Day](https://www.glaad.org/spiritday#intro) and promoted access to gender neutral bathrooms.
- Tabling at community youth events like [Boston Youth Pride](https://www.bostonpride.org/youthpride/) and [GLSEN](https://www.glsen.org/) conference.
- Facilitate bi-monthly Greater Boston Regional meetings.
- Attend bi-monthly State Council meetings.

The Massachusetts GSA Leadership council is a joint initiative of the [Massachusetts Department of Elementary and Secondary Education](http://www.doe.mass.edu/) and [Massachusetts Commission on LGBTQ Youth](https://www.mass.gov/orgs/massachusetts-commission-on-lgbtq-youth).

Over the 6 years I worked within the leadership council I had the opporunity to interact with many wonderful LGBTQ organizations such as:
- [Massachusetts Commission on LGBTQ Youth](https://www.mass.gov/orgs/massachusetts-commission-on-lgbtq-youth)
- [BAGLY (Boston Alliance of Lesbian, Gay, Bisexual, Transgender, Queer Youth )](https://www.bagly.org/)
- [GLAAD (Gay & Lesbian Alliance Against Defamation)](https://www.glaad.org/)
- [PFLAG (Parents, Families and Friends of Lesbians and Gays)](https://pflag.org/)
- [FLAG (Friends, Lesbians, and Gays) Flag Football](https://flagflagfootball.com/)

nodes.description: emphasizes foundational design principles in typography, color, image, illustration and layout. Design projects are instructed as an iterative process of problem identification, conceptualization, creation and critique.
nodes.concentration: Associates in Science Visual Design Degree 4.0 GPA

nodes.description: Hands-on experiences in the areas of advanced electronic imaging, advanced layout and design. Emphasis placed on the development of problem solving techniques, file rendering, and output.
